characters: ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE DECK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan at 48, looking years younger, in good shape, wakes suddenly from where he had dozed off on his couch in his small non descript, generically furnished, anonymous two bedroom apartment. The instruction manual for a Karaoke machine he was reading falls to the floor. We realize that this was not a home movie, but a dream. Bryan takes a moment to clear his head, looks around at h anonymous surroundings, his eyes focus on a picture of a year old girl on a horse in full dressage, Kim, his daugh grown up. He breathes out heavily, his heart hollow. He picks up the manual from the floor, looks at it. All is not right in his world. It shows in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan drives his innocuous three year old Nissan past the Hollywood sign, pulls into a modest strip mall. Parks in Front of a small appliance store. Exits the car with the Karaoke manual in hand. Enters the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan enters the cluttered store, which is jammed from fl to ceiling with every type of electronic gadget. He is greeted by the owner, SINGH, a turbaned Sikh.

dialogues.speaker: SINGH
dialogues.text: Mr. Mills, how are you?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I'm fine. How are you, Mr. Singh?  Â© INGH Very fine. I suppose you want to see it again?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: If you don't mind.

dialogues.speaker: SINGH
dialogues.text: An educated consumer is a happy consumer... You know where it is. Bryan walks over to a Karaoke machine.

dialogues.speaker: SINGH
dialogues.text: You know if I charged you a dollar for every time you came in to examine the machine, you'd already own it...twice over.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I was looking over the manual and I noticed on page seventeen there is an auto record feature, but I didn't remember seeing it... Singh presses a button and a disc slot opens up.

dialogues.speaker: SINGH
dialogues.text: Auto record. Bryan examines the machine along with the manual.

dialogues.speaker: SINGH
dialogues.text: Not for anything, but you know it's the one all the pros use. Mariah. Beyonce. Gwen Stefani.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Really? (beat) Who's Beyonce? Singh looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Only kidding. I'll take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan is studiously comparing a dozen different decorativ wrapping papers.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: May I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just want to make sure I'm picking the right one. Keeps examining the different papers. Detail oriented is description that fits Bryan toa T.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan is wrapping the Karaoke machine with a wrapping pap that reads young. Brightly colored, with balloons and confetti. He cuts the paper precisely, makes the corners match just so. As with everything else, he is meticulous. The way he folds it is unique, using no tape. His phone, on speaker, is ringing a number. The party on the other end answers.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: (accented) James residence.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: This is Bryan Mills. I'd like to speak to my daughter.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: One moment please. Bryan picks up, expecting his daughter. He answers with a brightness in his voice...

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Hi honey... That fades when he realizes it is... LENORE V.O. It's me Bryan. A bit of distance in her voice. Bryan stares at the pictu of Kim on his desk.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Oh hi. How are you? LENORE V.O. Busy preparing.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Is Kim there? LENORE V.O. Her stylist just arrived.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disappointed) Oh. Listen, I know the invitation calls for two, but I was going to ask if I could come over at one. LENORE V.O. You know, for a person who is such a stickler for details, you would think you'd read the invitation a little more closely. Two for her friends. Three for the adults.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I read it. I just thought maybe I could spend some one on one time with her, y'know, before things got busy. LENORE V.0O. Bryan, you missed so many of the events in her life, what difference does an hour make?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: (point of pride) I've never missed a birthday. LENORE V.O. I'll alert the media. (pause) Sorry. That wasn't necessary. I'm just in the middle of a lot here. The flowers came and they're the wrong pink. The DJ is stuck in traffic...

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I'll see you at three. Bryan hangs up, feels shut out. He looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clock on the dashboard reads one minute to three.

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK TO
dialogues.text: Bryan. Sitting in his Nissan, watching the clock, closely When the clock hits exactly three PM, he puts the car in gear, looks through the windshield, at a walled compound, where a line of Mercedes, Bentleys, Ferraris, Porsches, a passing the security at the gate of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan surrenders his car to a valet in the courtyard of t magnificent mansion, removes the wrapped karaoke machine from the back seat of his car, follows the rest of the ad toward the front door. Everyone else is dressed designer, Bryan is strictly off department store rack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan enters to a scene out of Homes of the Rich and Famo complete with the adult cast of characters. Beyond, through the French doors, in the vast grounds tha stretch to the ocean, a no-expense-spared party is in ful swing. An endless buffet attended by a dozen wait staff i set up under an expansive tent. On a dance floor laid ove the lawn, teenagers hold sway, dancing, flirting, junior versions of their parents. Off to the side, people line up to leave their gifts, whi are neatly organized into a small mountain by a maid. Bryan ignores the line when he sees KIM in the back yard. Not the twelve year old in the picture on his desk, but a young woman of seventeen. Tall, beautiful, full of life. golden girl, who carries privilege easily, surrounded by Friends, amidst a swirl of waiters, and photographers, videographers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan exits, is immediately intercepted by...

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY
dialogues.text: Uh, sir excuse me, but the adult party is inside.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I'm Kim's father.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY
dialogues.text: Excuse me, but I work for her father.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Her REAL father.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY
dialogues.text: Oh... And then...

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: It's alright Cyril.  The Security backs off as LENORE, the woman in the home video/dream, older, but still beautiful, dressed rich/cas the mistress of the exquisitely appointed mansion, appear

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: (cool) Hello Bryan.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Hello Lenore, The moment is awkward, at best.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I just wanted to give Kim her present.

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: We're letting the kids have their Own space. You can put it with all the others. She points to the pile of presents inside.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I wanted it to be more personal.

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: Still having trouble following the rules, I see.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Oh come on Lennie...

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: I've asked you not to call me that please.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Excuse me. (pointed) Lenore.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Hi... He turns to his daughter.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Hello darling. Happy birthday. He hands her the box.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Thanks! She hugs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just telling your father we arranged to have all the presents...

dialogues.speaker: . BRYAN
dialogues.text: Open it.

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: Sweetie, I think it's bad manners to open one and not...

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Here... He takes the bow off, pulls one end of the wrapping. The whole paper comes away neatly.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Cool.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: No tape. I learned it in Japan.

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: (bemused) A karaoke machine? The diminishing tone in her voice stings.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: (apologetic) I figured she wants to he a singer,

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: When she was twelve Bryan. We've moved on. Bemusement mixes with a barely contained disdain.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Thank you Daddy. She hugs him. And whispers in his ear.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: I still want to be a singer. Just don't tell Mom. A bit redeemed, Bryan takes out a disposable camera.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: OK. One for the book...

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: We have a professional photographer. Bryan ignores Lenore's roll of the eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big smile. Kim stands next to the machine, flashes a 24 karat smile. And just as Bryan snaps the picture, a commotion from the far side of the property draws her attention to... STUART JAMES, rich, polished, impeccably dressed and coif cantering a magnificent specimen of a horse through the g The crowd parts, and then, follows the horse and rider as they head right for an astonished Kim, a delighted Lenore chagrined Bryan. Stuart pulls on the reins and comes to an abrupt halt rig in front of Kim, Lenore and Bryan. He leaps off the horse hands the reins to Kim.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Happy birthday darling.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Oh my god! Oh my god! She throws her arms around his neck, peppers him with mad kisses.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: I love you! I love you! Bryan winces involuntarily, each word, each kiss a small nick on his heart.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Give him a try. Kim puts a foot in the stirrup, and with a boost from Stu she is in the saddle. Her seat is excellent, her command of the huge animal impressive. She jerks the reins, the horse responds, whee around and takes off at a canter across the lawn.

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: Stuart, you are impossible.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: I know. Hello Bryan.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Stuart. The two men shake hands; Stuart with all the confidence o man who knows he is ahead on points; Bryan with the feeli that he is losing ground rapidly.  9. Stuart looks over to Kim putting the horse through his pa on the far side of the vast expanse of lawn.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: She's not a little girl anymore, is she?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I guess not.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Staying for lunch?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: No. I just wanted to come by and wish her a happy birthday.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: I'm sure she appreciated it. Bryan smiles thinly. Lenore takes Stuart's arm.

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: Darling, now that you've made your grand entrance, come mingle.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Good to see you, Bryan.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: You too. As Lenore and Stuart walk off, arm in arm, Bryan looks ov to where Kim is surrounded by her friends admiring her ho He looks down at his sorry little karaoke machine, feelin outflanked. Isolated. ,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All neon and sale items. A clerk at the one hour developi booth hands Bryan a packet of photos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The picture of Kim with the karaoke machine. A photo albu cover marked HAPPY BIRTHDAY KIM.

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK TO
dialogues.text: Bryan. Pasting the picture in an album. He turns the page backwards. Every page is marked with the year and Kim's a over a birthday picture. Bryan lingers over each and every picture, regret mingled with the pleasure of reliving the moments.  10. The door bell rings, interrupting Bryan. He puts the albu aside, rises, heads for the door. He answers to three men. SAM, BERNIE, AND CASEY. In their hands, beer, wine, on their faces the knowledge that...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: You forgot. Bryan stands there, chagrined. He did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the cramped cement patio, Bryan is tending steaks on a small barbecue. While Sam preps some potatoes, Casey open the wine, and Bernie tosses the salad.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: It's not like I didn't call to remind you. LA? Third Saturday in May? Red meat, red wine? Sound familiar?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: He probably had a lot on his mind.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. The busy life of a retiree. Every day a new adventure.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: So what does one do in retirement? Take naps? Play golf? Chase rich widows?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: That takes care of the morning.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Go on, make fun. You know why I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: How's that going?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: OK. We had her birthday today. Seventeen.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: Lennie still have a hard on for you?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: She's not Lennie anymore. She's Lenore.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: She still has a hard on.  11.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: And the husband?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: The same. Perfect.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: You dig deep enough, there's always shit.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: You want us to dig?

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: What? You think he hasn't done that? Mr. Attention to Detail.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: How's Kim?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Good. She's good.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: She spend the night yet?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: We're working on it. The men trade a knowing look.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Does she appreciate the fact that you gave up your life to be close by?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: What life did I give up?

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: Hey, you remember that time we were in Beirut after the Chief disappeared, and Bry was deep under with that crazy fucking Sheik from Hezbollah? The one who was gonna get us inside, and then he disappeared?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: And we're sure your cover was blown and they were, like, pulling your fingernails out one by one.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: And we're scrambling to get the fuck outta Dodge before we get taken down. And where the fuck are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promised her I would never miss a birthday.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: That went down well at Langley when they found out you flew the coop to attend your kid's birthday...nine thousand miles away. Where did you say your next posting was? The Arctic circle spying on Penguins, I believe it was.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: Penguins are in Antarctica.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: What's the point here?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: We still got a space open, Bry. All you have to do is say the word, it's yours.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Who likes theirs rare? He lifts a steak off the grill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan is seeing his friends off. Sam stops at the door as the others walk to their car.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Look, all kidding aside, we think it's a great thing what you're doing, trying to make up for lost time with your kid. But tomorrow's job? Right here. Twenty five hundred bucks for four hours work. Just for taking some pop diva to and from her concert. We're one short.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: A singer?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I don't know if you could call her a singer exactly. More like a cash cow. Twenty million records. Gets as many death threats as marriage proposals.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: (quick) OK.  13.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Really.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Perfect. It'll be like old times.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Better. No one gets killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The downtown skyline glitters on a crystal clear night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lead car, followed by an SUV with blacked out windows swings around the rear of the arena, entering through the rear entrance, waved through by the Arena Security.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two cars stop. The doors open and the DIVA, a golden tressed pop goddess, exits with her entourage, surrounded Bernie, Sam, Casey, and Bryan. The press corp, kept at a distance, pops their flashes. A handful fans scream her name. The Diva flashes her widest smile, waves to the fans.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Ma'am if we can keep moving.

dialogues.speaker: DIVA
dialogues.text: My mother is ma'tam, if you don't mind. And as if to show whose boss, she stops, waves to the fan vamps for the photographers, before moving on into the dressing room.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Bernie, you and Casey are out here. I'll be up front. Bry, you're in the room. Bryan enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Diva is fussed over by her hair dresser and her ma up person, she warms up the pipes with Gio, running scale She sure can sing. She hits the last amazing high note, holds it forever. Bryan stands in the corner. As she finishes...  14.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: That was amazing. For the first time the Diva notices Bryan.

dialogues.speaker: DIVA
dialogues.text: Thank you. What did you say your name was?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Bryan. Bryan Mills.

dialogues.speaker: DIVA
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you Bryan Mills. She holds her hand out. He shakes it. A knock on the door

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: You're on! The Diva tenses a bit. Everyone gets jumped up.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Let's do it darling! The entourage starts for the door.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Excuse me... Everyone stops.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: (awkward) My daughter wants to be a singer... I was wondering...if you had any tips...

dialogues.speaker: DIVA
dialogues.text: (short) I do. Tell her to pick another career. The Diva sweeps out, Bryan is left in the room, feeling a bit chagrined for asking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the muted sound of the concert beyond the door, Brya Sam, Casey and Bernie play cards.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: So we're up on this ridge, right? Twelve thousand feet in the middle of bum fuck nowhere Kyrgyzstan. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Looking down on this shit hole mud and straw compound the target 1s holed up in. Freezing our asses off because it's like 15 degrees. Wind blowing like a motherfucker. The damn camels are farting away like the tubas in the Rose bowl parade. We're eating fried sheep ass for three days. We're waiting on the air strike, and we're waiting and we're waiting. And my cell phone rings. And it's the guy we're looking to terminate. He's calling to ask if we want some tea sent up to keep warm because he just heard the air strike was called off due to inclement weather. I mean, come on... A cell phone rings. Bryan's.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Hello? (brightens) Oh hi honey. (to the guys) Kim... He folds his cards, stopping the game.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Hey! Come on! I got a hot hand here! Bryan couldn't care less. He shrugs an "I'm sorry", exits the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music is blaring in the BG as Bryan steps out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: The noise? At a concert. You recognize the song? Right. That's her. No, I'm not attending. Just helping out some friends with the security. Of course I met her. Who do you think's guarding her? No, she's not a bitch. Yes. She's very nice. I'm glad you're impressed. Hey, I'm happy you called. Lunch? Tomorrow? Bryan's heart leaps at the possibility.  16.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Sure. I know the place. See you then. Love you too. Bryan hangs up, buoyed by the call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan steps back in, a smile on his face.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: And...?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: She wants to have lunch. (beat) Just the two of us.

dialogues.speaker: GUYS
dialogues.text: Alright! There's progress! A date with your daughter! Will wonders never cease? Bryan smiles sheepish, takes the kidding, but is so pleas

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: The show is over, entourage is streaming back stage. The Diva is taking one last curtain call. The cars are lined up, ready to go. Sam and his team are at the ready, when all of the sudden, from the side of the arena, a door bur open and a wave of frenzied fans come running.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Who left that door open? Just then the Diva appears. The mob sees her.

dialogues.speaker: MOB
dialogues.text: There she is!! As they surge, the Diva seems to freeze, panic.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: OK. Let's get her out of here. Bry. Take the lead. More people come surging from the stage now.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: This way! Sam, Bernie and Casey cover the rear as Bryan leads the D towards the waiting cars. Suddenly the situation deteriorates. More fans press in past the barriers.  17.

dialogues.speaker: FANS
dialogues.text: She's there! Bryan, keeping her in front of him, keeping his eye over shoulder does not see a lone man in a long coat, suddenly lunging out of the shadows. As he turns, his reactions ki in. He leaps in front of the terrified Diva just as the knife is about to plunge into her. In the blink of an eye, he grabs the knife hand, twists i back in one swift movement, turning the coat sleeve insid out on the knife, delivers one swift blow that puts the assailant on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Casey! Casey pins the guy down.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Go! Bryan spins the Diva around, pushes her into the car, jum in behind her...

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Go! Slams the door. The car zooms out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car blasts out of the arena. The Diva, alone with Bryan in the back of the car, is sha like a leaf.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Here, Drink this. Hands her a coke.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: The sugar will ward off the shock. She drinks, gulps. Stops to take a breath. And then break down, starts sobbing. She drops onto Bryan's chest, sobs and sobs. Bryan lets his arms wrap around her, awkward, b gentle.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: It's OK. You're safe... Doing his best to comfort what is now a hysterical, scare little girl.  18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is handing each man his cash. Hands the Waves the Just then head out,

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Casey...Bernie... cash to Bryan.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Rambo...

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Hey...c'mon...

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: Seriously, Bry. You should think about coming with us. You still got the edge. Lot more of this to be had. cash.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Next year she goes to college, right?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: You know you lose her.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: That gives me a year to find her. the Diva's door opens, a somber Victor sticks his nods to Bryan.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: She would like to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan enters to a very subdued Diva.

dialogues.speaker: DIVA
dialogues.text: You said your daughter wants to be a singer?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Since she's five.

dialogues.speaker: DIVA
dialogues.text: You know it's not what everyone thinks it is.  19.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I'm sure it's not.

dialogues.speaker: DIVA
dialogues.text: After the glam wears off it's just lots of airports, lots of hotels. Everyone kissing your ass, telling you what you want to hear...worrying that the next record hits. Because if it doesn't, there's the next you just waiting in the wings.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Tt's what she wants. The Diva gives him a card.

dialogues.speaker: DIVA
dialogues.text: The first number is Gio, my voice coach. He has the best ear in the business. If he says she can sing, she can sing. He'll give her the voice coaching she needs. His fee is on me. The second number is my manager. If Gio clears her, he'll make sure she gets the shot. (beat) I'm sorry for the way I behaved before. I wasn't brought up that way. Bryan nods, acknowledging her apology. Holds up the card.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: DIVA
dialogues.text: No. Mr. Mills, thank you. She kisses him on the cheek, disappears into her bedroom. Bryan stands there, alone in the huge suite, can't help b fee] things seem to be going his way. He looks at the car

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the card,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan sits, turning the card over in his hand, feeling ve pleased, excited at what he has to offer. He looks up to.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Hi! But his smile dies as he also sees...  20.

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: Hello Bryan.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Hi. His excitement subdues, he palms the card.

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: Don't look so excited.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I was just surprised. I thought it was just going to be...y'know... He points to the two of them.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: I asked Mom to come. As they take their seats, Kim just bubbles with excitemen

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Guess what? You know my Â£riend Amanda? Her cousins invited us to stay with them over vacation. (beat) In Paris. How cool is that? Bryan is less than thrilled to hear this.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: âWhy do you want to go to Paris?

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Dad! Hello? The Louvre, the Impressionist museum. The Picasso Museum?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I didn't know you were so into art.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? I've been to the MoMA, like, a hundred times. Amanda went last summer and she came home she could practically speak French! Now Bryan gets the reason for the lunch. He deflates a bi

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: (tightening) And because you're under eighteen you need my permission to leave the country.  21.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Please Daddy. I really want to do it! They have this, like, sick apartment overlooking the river.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Just you and Amanda.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: And her cousins!

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: Don't make a big deal out of this Bryan. Just sign the paper. She puts the paper out for him, with a pen. He does not move.

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I'm not comfortable with it.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Daddy!

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I know the world sweetie..

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: It's not Iraq!

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: It's seven thousand miles. It's another country.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Daddy please!

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: T'm sorry sweetie. I don't think a seventeen year old should be traveling alone.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: I won't be alone!

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Two seventeen year olds.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Amanda's eighteen! Bryan considers for a moment.  a2.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Well, how about this? How about I go along? Kim rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: You won't even know I'm there. I'm very good at invisible.

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: As you have so amply demonstrated for most of her life. The bite in her words makes him tighten even more.

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: Just sign the god damn paper Bryan. Bryan looks from Lenore, to Kim, to the paper, and back t Kim again.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Let me think about it.

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: That's a no. (to Kim) I knew this was a waste of time. (to Bryan) I told her. Kim bolts up.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Kim...there's something else... He brings up the card.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: I don't want anything else! Kim runs off.

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: You know, I don't get you. You sacrificed our marriage in the service of the country. You made a mess of your life in the service of your country. Can't you sacrifice a little this one time for your own daughter?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I'd sacrifice anything for her.

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: Then what is your problem.  23.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: T am not comfortable putting my daughter at risk.

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: Putting your daughter at risk? By going to Paris? You're pathetic. She follows Kim out. Bryan is left looking at the paper, and the Diva's card i his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hand knocks on a door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door is opened by a puffy eyed Kim. She looks at Brya suspicious, sees the paper in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Three conditions... Kim's suspicion begins to melt.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I want the address and phone number where you are staying. Her smile begins to build.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: If you move, I want to know where and with whom you will be staying.

dialogues.speaker: OK.
dialogues.text: The smile grows.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: You call me when you land. You call me every night before you go to sleep. He hands her a phone.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: It's international. My number is programmed in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The smile is ear to ear.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: And I want you to let me take you to the airport.

dialogues.speaker: OK. OK.
dialogues.text: Bryan hands her the paper. She leaps on his neck. Kissing him. Hugging him.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Thank you! Thank you! I'm gonna go call Amanda! She runs off. A second later she is back. Hugs Bryan agai

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: I love you Daddy!!! Off she goes, passing Lenore, who has just come to the do

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: He signed it! Waves the paper in front of Lenore, bolts off; Leaving Br and Lenore looking at each other.

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: Wouldn't it have been easier just to sign the first time around?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Wouldn't it have been easier if you and I talked about it first? She has no answer to that, closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan and Kim on the way to the airport. Kim is wearing a jean jacket with a heart of red sequins embroidered on th Front.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: There are certain areas in Paris that you should avoid. I've written them down... He hands her a piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Daddy, we're going to be spending, like, ninety percent of our time in museums. You don't have to worry.  25.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: That's like telling water not to be wet.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Mom says your job made you paranoid.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: My job made me aware.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: I always used to ask mom what your job was that you were away all the time. She would tell me to ask you. But when ever I saw you I was afraid to ask.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: I don't know, Maybe because I was afraid to find out. That it was something I wouldn't like.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I worked for the government.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: You were, like, a spy, right?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I was a preventer.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: What did you prevent?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Bad things from happening.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: So that was a good job.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Yes it was.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Do you miss it?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I missed you more. Kim leans over. Kisses him on the cheek, as the car enter LAX .  26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan is lifting her suitcase out of the trunk, when Kim sees...

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: There's Amanda! A pretty blonde girl waves to her from inside the termina

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Go ahead. I'll bring your bags. Kim goes running into the terminal. Bryan watches her go, sees the word DOLLFACE in sequined script across the back her jacket. It makes him smile. He goes to grab the smaller hand luggage out of the trunk sees a map in the side pocket. Knowing better, but not be able to resist, he takes the map out. Bryan's POV A map of Europe, with different cities circled in several countries, with dates next to each one. He does not like what he sees. He puts the map back, is about to lift the luggage, when chauffeured Rolls Royce pulls right in front of him. He gives a small grimace. And sure enough, the chauffeur opens the door and Lenore exits.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Charles... Calls to the chauffeur.

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: Give Mr. Mills a hand.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I can manage. Bryan picks up both bags, slams the trunk with his elbow. Lenore heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Lenore. Can I talk to you a minute? She stops.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Do you know about this? He takes out the map.  27.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: She's not just going to Paris.

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: This is bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: No Bryan, what's bullshit is she can't be honest with you because of your bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My bullshit?

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: The rules and conditions...

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: What is it? Referring to the map.

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: It's U2's European tour dates.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: She's following a band around Europe?

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: All the kids do. Stuart got her the tickets, we've arranged for her to stay in good hotels.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: (pissed) Good hotels? You know, you live in your little bubble here, behind your wall, with your chauffeurs and maids and stylists... He catches himself as his contempt builds.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: You have no idea what the world is like Lenore.

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: And neither will she unless she goes out and experiences it. And don't you tell me I do not know what the world is like. For five years I would wait for a phone call that didn't come for weeks at a time. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: LENORE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: For a knock on the door telling me there would be no calls anymore. I became an expert on foreign affairs. I read the paper every day Bryan. Beirut, Teheran, Bogota. Damascus. Looking for a hint, a glimmer of light behind that curtain you pulled over what you did.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I did it to protect you.

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: From what? Worrying? You think not knowing made me worry less? You think being shut out of your life protected me? She catches herself, checks her anger, takes a breath.

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: I know we have our issues. But I'm going to give you a piece of advice. You moved here to try and build some sort of relationship with your daughter. You're not going to do that by smothering her. Let her live or I promise you, you'll lose her. (beat) And for god's sake, don't ruin this For her. Lenore turns and enters the terminal, leaving Bryan to de with the bags and the information he cannot act on, leavi him frustrated, impotent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan, and Lenore are waving goodbye as their daughter an Amanda pick up their knap sacks on the other side of the ray machines. The girls wave goodbye, with their barely containable excitement sparkling in their eyes. Bryan stands off to the side, a forced smile on his face. Waves to Kim, hold his hand up to his ear like a phone. K smiles, nods, waves, mouths an "JT love you". Bryan snaps a picture of Kim and Amanda mugging with his disposable camera. And then they run off down the concourse. Free. The last thing Bryan sees as Kim disappears in the crowd, the back of her jacket and the word in glistening sequins DOLLFACE.  29.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I love you too. Said to her. Heard by no one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Air France flight lifts off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bustling with arrivals off flights from all over the worl Amanda and Kim come rushing out of customs, laughing, delighted to be free and in Paris. They burst through the doors to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kim and Amanda wait on line for a cab. Using her cell pho Kim is snapping a picture of Amanda pointing to a sign overhead that says TAXIS.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Need some help? The girls turn to cute, shaggy haired, PETER, 22, knap sa slung over his shoulder, with the most charming Euro acce voice. He points to the cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: One with the two of you?

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: Sure. Kim hands him the phone.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Top button. She and Amanda mug under the sign. Peter clicks one.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: One more. He clicks one more. Hands the phone back to Kim.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Where are you from?

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: California.  30.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (singing) I wish they all could be California girls... The girls giggle, instantly flirty and smitten.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: T'm Peter.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: I'm Amanda. This is Kim.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: (a bit shy) Hi.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Going into Paris?

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: The taxis are so damn expensive here. Want to share?

dialogues.speaker: OR.
dialogues.text: They load their luggage in the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan is looking at pictures the clerk just handed him of Kim at the airport, while he listens to his cell phone. A voice prompt comes on.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: To check arrivals please press one. Bryan presses one.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Please enter the flight number. Bryan does.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Flight 288 arrived in Paris Charles De Gaulle at 8 AM local time. Bryan hangs up, begins to worry.  31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter helps Amanda and Kim carry their luggage to the fro door of the very fashionable apartment building.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Nice address.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: It's my cousin's. They're on vacation in Madrid. We have the place all to ourselves. How cool is that?

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: (nervous) I didn't know that.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: No biggie. Amanda takes out a piece of paper, begins to punch the co on the keypad outside.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: You're living a dream. Nice life.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: It is, isn't it? The door buzzes open.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Well, I have to be going. Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: You too. Peter goes to walk away. Then turns.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Hey... The girls are almost inside.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: There's a party tonight at school. Want to come?

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: (whispered, nervous) Amanda. We don't even know him!  32.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: What's to know? He's hot.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: [I'll come pick you up around nine?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: What apartment?

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: It's the whole fifth floor.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: And the code? Amanda reads off the paper.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: 26432A. See you tonight.

dialogues.speaker: GIRLS
dialogues.text: Bye! The door closes. As soon as it does, Peter takes out a ce phone, dials.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Twenty Rue de la Pompe. Fifth floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kim and Amanda enter an amazing full floor apartment, a m of contemporary art and antique furnishings spreading out room after room,

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: Is this sick or what?

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: I wish you would have told me they weren't going to be here.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: What's the difference?

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: I told my father they were here.  33.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: You told him you were going to museums too. Suddenly lying is not feeling so good to Kim.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: Oh come on! He's not going to know! (beat) I'm going to sleep with him.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: Peter.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: You just met him!

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: I hear French guys are amazing in bed. Maybe he has a friend...

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: No thank you.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: You've got to lose it sometime. Might as well be in Paris! How cool would that be? Losing it in Paris. To an artist! From the look on Kim's face, not cool at all. Amanda pops open an antique chest to a fully equipped sound system. Pops a disc into the CD player, cranks the sound way up. Music starts blasting, she starts dancing, gyrating sexil

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: Party! Kim smiles weakly, clearly nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan is pacing, nervous. The clock reads two AM. He can' take another minute. He picks up the phone, dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music is blasting, Amanda is dancing all around the apartment, singing at the top of her lungs. Kim shouts.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Where's the bathroom?  34.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: (shouting) What?

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: I have to pee! Amanda points down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan lets the phone ring and ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Kim's hand bag, sitting along with her luggage in the hall. Her cell rings and rings, cannot be heard over the blasting music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone rings next to the bed. Lenore answers from a de sleep.

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: It's Bryan. Did Kim call you?

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: Bryan, she's seventeen, she's in Paris. Give her some space. She'll call. Take a Xanax, have a drink. Good night. She hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan stares at his phone.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Will you call, god damn it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kim finishes peeing, flushes. Exits.  35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kim exits, hears her phone ringing. She knows who it is. Answers with a knot in her stomach.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Hi Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: INT, BRYAN'S APARTMENT
dialogues.text: As much as he would like to, Bryan cannot contain his anxiety.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: You were supposed to call me when you landed.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Sorry. Bryan takes a deep breath, pulls back.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: OK. I thought maybe something was wrong with the phone.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: It was such a rush at the airport...

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: That's alright. If I would have had the number where you were staying, I could have just called there. You have the number?

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: I...1I don't have it.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Well, let me talk to the cousins, T'll get it from them.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Daddy... It all comes tumbling out.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: They went to Spain. I didn't know, I swear... Bryan takes a deep breath, trying to be reasonable, hatin not being in control. Hating the sound of a situation tha to him, is going downhill fast.  36.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Is there anything else you want to tell me Kim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kim stands with the phone to her ear, fear etched on her face, in her eyes, as she stares through a window, across courtyard, into the other side of the apartment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan gets no response.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Kim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Kim does respond, it is in a choked, terrified whisp

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: There's someone here! As she stares across the courtyard at three men crossing hallway heading for an oblivious Amanda dancing up a stor in the salon.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Her cousins?

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: (shocked) No! Oh my god! As she sees Amanda being grabbed by the men.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: They got Amanda! (terrified) Daddy!!! Bryan's worst nightmare quickly coming true.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Alright. Listen to me. His voice is very calm. He moves to a closet.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: T'm sorry I lied to you Daddy!

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: We']l]1 deal with that later.  37. Bryan extracts a black case from the closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy! I'm scared!

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I know you are sweetheart. I'm going to help you. But first I need you to help me. You have to stay focused. Did you meet anyone on the plane?

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: No. Bryan opens the case. It contains all manner of things: A gun, several electronic devices, cash, multiple passports

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: In the airport?

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: No. Begins to lose it, begins to cry, stifles the tears. Recomposes.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Yes. Peter.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Peter who?

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: American?

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Did he know where you were staying?

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Yes. He took a cab with us. Bryan grimaces, knows a set up when he hears it. He extra an electronic device from the case, attaches it to the ph Switches it on. It amplifies Kim's voice, and all the sou around her. Kim watches the window, as the men drag Amanda away.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Daddy! They took her! They took her!  38. She starts to lose it, starts to cry. Bryan's apartment i now filled with the sounds from the apartment in Paris.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Kim. You have to hold it together. How many people are there? Be precise. Kim does her best to pull herself together.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Three. Four. I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Bedroom. She begins to sob. The music is blasting. Kim sees three men cross one of the windows in the connecting hall, head towards her. Opening doors along the way, searching.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: They're coming!

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: (calm) Climb under the bed. Tell me when you are there. Bryan does his best to contain his rising anxiety, to sta calm. Kim is now under the bed.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: T'm here,

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Now, the next part is very important. They are going to take you..

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Oh god... Kim stifles a terrified cry.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Kim. Stay focused baby. This is key. You will have five, maybe ten seconds. Very important seconds. Leave the phone on the floor. You must concentrate. Shout out everything you see about them. Hair color, eye color, tall, short, scars. Anything you see. You understand?  39. Just then footsteps enter the room.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: They're there. I can hear them. Remember. Concentrate. Bryan waits. Kim waits. Footsteps circle the room. Bryan can hear them, the waiti is excruciating.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Put the phone closer so I can hear. Kim sees the shoes, sees them circle the bed. She holds h breath. Hears voices in a language completely unfamiliar. Bryan listens, not moving a muscle. Kim watches the feet move towards the door. Bryan hears the footsteps receding. Kim sees the feet leave the room. She breathes out in complete silence.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: (whispered) They're leaving... Bryan listens closely. Kim begins to relax.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: (whispered) I think they're... And then a set of hands grab her legs, violently. She screams.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: DADDYYYYYYY!! ir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kim's scream reverberates through the room, shaking the w shocks Bryan. And even though it reaches into his very co he does not move. He calls on all his experience to stay focused on the task. He listens to his daughter struggle. And shout out... KIM V.O. Mustache. Six feet. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: KIM V.O., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tattoo on right hand. Moon and star...DADDDYYYY!!!! DADDDYYY!!!!! The sound of glass shattering. And then her voice is silenced. Bryan still does not move, sits very still, listening...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hand takes Kim's phone from under the bed.

dialogues.speaker: ON BRYAN
dialogues.text: He hears the sound of breathing coming over the speakers, filling the room. After a moment...

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I don't know who you are. I don't know what you want. If you are looking for a ransom, I can tell you, I don't have money. But what I do have are a very particular set of skills acquired over a very long career in the shadows, skills that make me a nightmare for people like you. If you let my daughter go now, that will be the end of it. I will not look for you, I will not pursue you. But if you don't, I will look for you, I will find you. And I will kill you. There is a long silence. Just breathing coming over the line.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: (accented) Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: ON BRYAN
dialogues.text: Hearing the two words filling the room.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Good luck. And then the shrill sound of a phone being smashed. The line goes dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan drives at breakneck speed, phone to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Sam, It's me. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm going to download something. I need it analyzed. Now. Bryan plugs the recording device into his phone. Hits a button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens to Lenore and Stuart, both roused from sle Both very unnerved.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: She's been taken. Bryan moves right past them. Man on a mission. Heads up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: Oh my god! Bryan keeps going. Lenore and Stuart follow.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Any enemies overseas Stuart?

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Why would I have...

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Because you do business overseas through three shell corporations registered to dead drop addresses in Liechtenstein, Monaco and The Jersey Islands. Because you were involved in an oil deal with a bunch of Russians that went south five years ago.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: How the hell do you know...

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Because I was not going to let my daughter live with someone without knowing everything about them.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: I'm not without my sources too: OK? Don't think you're the only one with access to... Bryan cuts him short, with the coldest voice he has ever heard. A voice that shakes him.  42.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Now's not the time for dick measuring Stuart. I'm going to ask you again. Do you have anyone who would be looking to hurt you?

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: (shaken) Not that I know of. Bryan comes to the top of the stairs, and half a dozen cl doors.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Which one?

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: I want to know what happened!

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I got a call from her, she said there was someone in the apartment. Then she was taken.

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: Oh my god! Bryan what are you going to...?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Every minute I stop to answer your questions is a minute I lose in getting her back. Which one Lenore?

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: That one. She points to a door. Bryan goes through to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room of a rich girl, filled with all the accouterment Bryan begins a thorough search. Bryan finds a picture of himself and five year old Kim bu in a drawer. Pauses for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: What can I do?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: You have a lease agreement with NetJet through your Bahamian umbrella company . Stuart wonders: Is there anything Bryan does not know?  43.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Get me a plane for Paris.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: For when?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: An hour ago. Exchanges a look with Lenore.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: T'll make the call. Stuart exits. Bryan continues searching, finds a condom in a drawer. Ho it up.

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: I gave it to her. (beat) Just in case. (beat) She's still a virgin. Are you going to be able to save her?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: First I have to find her. Bryan's phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Got it? He looks across the room to Kim's computer on her desk.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Yes. I have access. Plugs the cell phone into the computer with a wire from h pocket. The computer boots up fast. Sam comes on screen.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Go.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: They're speaking Albanian. The accent comes from a district called Skopje. The man speaking, his name is Marko. The tattoo is a group ID. Sam pauses.  44.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Are you by yourself?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Lenore's here.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Hi Lennie.

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: Hello Sam. Again a pause.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: She needs to hear it Sam.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: The specialty of the gangs coming out of there is trafficking in women. Lenore gasps.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Keep going.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Their previous M.O. was to offer women from the emerging East European countries like Yugoslavia, Romania, Bulgaria jobs in the West. Maids, nannies. Once they smuggled them in, they'd addict them to drugs and turn them into prostitutes. Lately, they've found it is more economical to just kidnap young women traveling. Saves on transportation costs. Lenore lets out a strangled scream...

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: Oh god!

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: What else?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Based on what they know about the way these groups operate, the analyst Said you probably have a ninety six hour window from the time she's grabbed...

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: To what?  45.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: To never finding her. Hits Bryan like a thunderbolt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan is the only passenger, he sits with the recording device, listening to the recorded conversation with Kim. Hears...

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Mustache...tattoo...moon and star... Hears her screams. Fast forwards. Hears himself...

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I don't know who you are. I don't know what you want... Fast forwards to...

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Good luck, Plays this over several times, listening very carefully t the voice, etching it in his memory.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Good luck...good luck...good luck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The private jet lands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hand rings the bell. The door opens.

dialogues.speaker: CONCIERGE
dialogues.text: (curt) Yes?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: (French) The Morels please.

dialogues.speaker: CONCIERGE
dialogues.text: The Morels are away. Officious and cold, as only a French concierge can be.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Yes, I know. In Spain. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Their cousin and my daughter are staying in the apartment while they are away. You've seen them, yes? Two American girls? He holds up the picture he took at LAX of Kim and Amanda mugging for the camera.

dialogues.speaker: CONCLERGE
dialogues.text: No. I didn't. Excuse me. He closes the door. Bryan rings again. Again the concierg opens.

dialogues.speaker: CONCTERGE
dialogues.text: If you continue I will be obliged to call the police. Before the words are out of his mouth, Bryan knocks him o with a well placed knuckle blow to his neck. He catches t falling body, stepping through the open door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan props the unconscious Concierge in his booth, heads into the building itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan is at the door to the Morel apartment. He tries to pick the locks, cannot. Looks around, sees a small window in the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan squeezes his body out the window into the air shaft scales his way across the narrow shaft, using every avail foot hold and hand hold. Several times his hands slip, his feet lose their tractio but bit by bit, he makes his way across the shaft until h comes to a set of small windows. Bryan punches out one of the panes, opens the window, squ inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan lands in the bathroom. Looks around, exits. Bryan moves from room to room. In the room where Amanda was seized, he sees an overturne chair, an up ended corner of a rug. He kneels down, exami the room from that angle.  47].

dialogues.speaker: FLASHES
dialogues.text: Of Amanda being grabbed by men whose faces are obscured. Of the chair being overturned as she struggles to break f

dialogues.speaker: END FLASHES
dialogues.text: Bryan moves through the apartment, taking everything in. sees the girl's luggage, untouched. Looks through both suitcases. Moves on. Until he comes to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan looks out the window across the open courtyard. He switches on his tape recorder. Begins to hear what he is seeing.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: Sees what Kim saw. Three men grabbing a struggling Amanda

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan, with the recorder playing.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Go under the bed. Looks under the bed, then slips under the bed, puts himse in Kim's place, looks out. The recorder keeps playing.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: Sees what Kim saw, hears what she heard. Feet entering th room.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: Tt is now Bryan looking out. Then...

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: It is Kim seeing the feet, seeing the man reach under the bed, grabbing her leg. Kim screams. Bryan, shocked, is out from under the bed now, sees a sha on a mirror.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: Sees Kim lifted off her feet by an unseen man, and in her struggle, has her head smashed into the mirror. The sound is sickeningly loud. Bryan winces.  48. He approaches the mirror, examines the spot of impact. Yo can feel his pain as he carefully removes a hair and some dried blood, puts the samples in a bag. His jaw tightens, his eyes turn murderous. And then he notices something tossed in the corner: Kim's smashed cel phone. Bryan removes the chip from the back of the smashed phone examines it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chip being inserted into a machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan is looking at the screen of the machine. He sees: pictures of Amanda and Kim vamping and mugging in the LA airport, on the plane, in the Paris Airport. Each picture is of one or the other. Except the last one, where they are both mugging for the camera on the taxi li Bryan starts to manipulate the framing of the picture unt he catches a glimpse of a reflection in a security mirror the person taking the picture. Bryan keeps manipulating the frame, discovering more and more of the reflection, until a face appears, fuzzy, out focus. Bryan keeps pushing buttons, until the entire reflection the person taking the picture comes clear: Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter, leafing through a magazine. A voice announces.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Flight seven twenty arriving from Barcelona.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter stands by the magazine kiosk, just outside customs. He looks over to a big BLACK GUY standing near the Custom exit. The Black Guy nods to a cute blond girl in her late teens exiting from customs with a back pack and a Swiss flag on it, heading for the exit.  49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blond girl is waiting on the taxi line when...

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Hi. I'm Peter.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Ingrid.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: On holidays?

dialogues.speaker: GIRD
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Me too. As a cab pulls up.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: The cabs here are so damn expensive. Want to share?

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: sure. Peter holds the door of a taxi open for the girl, smiling flirting. The girl is about to get in, when...

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Bryan hustles Peter past the astonished girl, pushes him into the cab, follows, slamming the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (struggling) Hey! What are you...? Bryan buries a sharp knuckle into his ribs, knocking the breath out of Peter, doubling him over. Bryan lifts his head.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: The two girl from yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I don't...

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: What are you doing?  50.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Drive. Peter tries to escape. Bryan drives his knuckle into Pete ribs again. The Taxi Driver flees the cab.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: The next rib I drive into your lungs. The Driver runs out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: The two girls. Where are they? Suddenly, the door behind Bryan is yanked open and two la black hands drag him out by his legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan hits the pavement hard. Before he can get up, the b Black Guy pounds on him. Smashing him over and over. Passengers run, screaming. The Guy grabs Bryan, yanks him up like a sack of potatoes Except this sack of potatoes is a lethal weapon. Before t guy knows what has happened, Bryan has grabbed his wrists ripped them down, bashed his forehead into the Guy's nose double punched him in his exposed throat. The Guy falls, face gushing blood, hands grasping his thr unable to breathe. Bryan turns back to the cab, only to find the other passe door open and Peter gone. Bryan sees Peter running up the road, holding his damaged ribs.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Arretez! Arretez! Bryan turns to see three police Officers running towards him, with the taxi driver trailing them. Bryan leaps into the taxi, jams it into gear, rips a u tu and rockets off after Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter runs, desperate to escape, his ribs on fire with ev breath. He looks over his shoulder, sees the taxi gaining on him. He cuts off onto a one way ramp with traffic streaming down towards Bryan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the windshield, Bryan sees Peter running up a ram that has nothing but cars coming at him.  51. Unable to negotiate the narrow ramp packed with oncoming traffic, Bryan leaps out of the cab, blocking the road, snarling traffic to a stand still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan takes off at a dead run up the ramp, running agains the traffic, zig zagging through the cacophony of blaring horns and irate drivers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter. At the very top of the overpass. His breath coming in jagged bursts, the pain in his side increasing with ea step. He looks back, sees Bryan gaining on him. Almost on him. He is running out of room, out of breath. He looks down to a roadway below, where the traffic is very sparse He looks back at Bryan, closing fast. Looks down at the roadway. Makes a choice. Jumps. Lands. Bryan reaches the top of the overpass, looks down. Peter looks up at him, victorious, safe. And then gets SLAMMED by a truck that comes out of nowher at forty miles an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEAN-CLAUDE, the picture of a middle aged French bureaucr exits the building and crosses the street to a news stand He buys a paper, continues walking. He passes a cafe. A man is reading a newspaper. A moment later, the newspaper comes down. It is Bryan. He rises, atarts walking after Jean-Claude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean-Claude has stopped to look in a window. He walks on. A moment later, Bryan's reflection walks past the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean-Claude waits for the light to change. Bryan comes up alongside him, neither man acknowledging the other. The light changes, they walk to the middle of the street, whe the second light is red. Both wait.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN
dialogues.text: Just like the old days, eh? Jean-Claude looks straight ahead, seeming to talk to no o in particular. Bryan does not look at him.  52.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Would you have it any other way?

dialogues.speaker: JEAN-CLAUDE
dialogues.text: Between you and me? No. But now that I sit behind a desk, the world looks different.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: You mean looks boring.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN- CLAUDE
dialogues.text: I mean different. (beat ) OK. A little boring. But is being retired any more interesting?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: It wasn't. (beat) Until my daughter disappeared in Paris yesterday. Jean-Claude is caught unawares.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: She and a friend were marked by a spotter at the airport. Albanians took her.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN -CLAUDE
dialogues.text: How do you know this?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I'm retired. Not dead.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN
dialogues.text: I assume you do not want to go to the police.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I was told I have ninety six hours. That was sixteen hours ago. By the time I fill out the missing person reports...get interviewed by some clerk...

dialogues.speaker: JEAN- CLAUDE
dialogues.text: First, we should find the spotter.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I found him. Jean-Claude registers surprise.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: He's dead.  93.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN- CLAUDE
dialogues.text: You found him that way? Bryan says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN
dialogues.text: Bryan, you cannot just run around tearing down Paris... Bryan turns, and faces Jean-Claude.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Jean-Claude, I will tear the fucking Biffel tower down if I have to.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN -CLAUDE
dialogues.text: Don't forget who you are talking to.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I thought I was talking to a friend.

dialogues.speaker: J EAN
dialogues.text: You are. But please remember your friend has a desk now. Jean-Claude hands Bryan a card.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: (reading) Deputy director. Internal Security. Very impressive desk. (beat) The Albanians.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN
dialogues.text: They showed up from the East six, seven years ago. Fifteen, twenty of them. Now there are hundreds. We don't even know how many. And dangerous. They make the Russians look like a bunch of schoolgirls.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Where can I find them?

dialogues.speaker: JEAN- CLAUDE
dialogues.text: The best place to start is Porte De Clichy. Bryan heads of â¬Â£.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN
dialogues.text: Bryan. He turns.  54.

dialogues.speaker: J RAN-CLAUDE
dialogues.text: Try not to make a mess. Bryan says nothing, walks off. Jean-Claude waits until he has turned a corner, takes out his phone. Hits one speed dial key.

dialogues.speaker: JRHAN
dialogues.text: Mills, Bryan, American, fifty, hair brown, eyes blue. Knows the game. Destination. Porte De Clichy. Report comes to me directly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the second story window: Bryan talking to a man b a desk, who takes notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan drives out of the lot into the Parisian night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean-Claude sits on the edge of a bed reading a story to two young children.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN
dialogues.text: ...and then the Minimoy saw that Arthur meant them no harm... The door opens, ISABELLE, his wife appears ,holding the p

dialogues.speaker: LSABELLE
dialogues.text: Your assistant. Jean-Claude takes the phone. ASSISTANT V.O. He visited an employment agency. He rented a car. We have someone on it.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN- CLAUDE
dialogues.text: Keep me informed.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: Yes sir. Jean-Claude hangs up the phone, resumes reading.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN
dialogues.text: Where were we? The Minimoys liked Arthur...  25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars with men behind the wheels cruise the dimly lit stre as hookers ply their trade. The whole area has an edgy, dangerous feel to it. A man, GREGOR, in his mid forties, struggling to maintain whatever shards of dignity he has salvaged from a life interrupted, in a proper, if worn suit, carrying a briefc stands on a street corner, looking very ill at ease in th ominous surroundings. A car approaches, the window rolls down. :

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Gregor Milocivic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relieved) Yes. Yes. I am Gregor.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I'm Mr. Smith. Get in. Bryan opens the door, Gregor enters the car, grateful to off the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregor hands Bryan a sheet of paper.

dialogues.speaker: GREGOR
dialogues.text: Here is my resume. The employment agency said we would be doing translation.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Yes. Albanian to English. You do speak Albanian?

dialogues.speaker: GREGOR
dialogues.text: Albanian, Serbian, Croatian. Macedonian, although it is very close to Albanian. I was a teacher of language in Pristina before the war began, so naturally...

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: What's your rate?

dialogues.speaker: GREGOR
dialogues.text: My rate? Usually it is twenty five an hour for the first three hours and then... Bryan hands him a handful of bills.  56.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Here's for ten hours. Wait here. Bryan goes to exit.

dialogues.speaker: GREGOR
dialogues.text: Uh, Mr. Smith. I do not understand. What is the job?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Right now the job is waiting here. Bryan exits the car, locks the doors. Gregor watches him walk toward the gathering of hookers down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan approaches one of the hookers.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Bon soir.

dialogues.speaker: HOOKER
dialogues.text: Bon soir. You want a date?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I love your dress. What is that? Silk?

dialogues.speaker: HOOKER
dialogues.text: I don't know. You want to know the prices?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Just the way it falls. It must be silk. You know the way it compliments the natural curves of your body... A car passes by, slows, looks at the hooker, then moves o to another girl.

dialogues.speaker: HOOKER
dialogues.text: You want to fuck? It's forty Euros. Suck is thirty. Hand job is twenty.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Twenty? For a hand job? Must be a hell of a hand doing the job for twenty euros. Ha, ha, get it? Hand, job...

dialogues.speaker: HOOKER
dialogues.text: Listen, if you are not buying, piss off.  57.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I didn't say I wasn't buying. MI just like to get comfortable before I purchase, Like this karaoke machine I just bought. I read the manual Erom front to back...

dialogues.speaker: HOOKER
dialogues.text: I don't give a shit about your karaoke machine. You're gonna get me in trouble, you don't buy.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Trouble? Really? With who?

dialogues.speaker: HOOKER
dialogues.text: Fuck off. She starts to walk away, Bryan follows.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: OK. Let's say I want two of the three, do I get a discount? Another car passes, the girl tries to wave the driver dow but Bryan stands in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Or how about all three? Sort of a package deal. The car drives on.

dialogues.speaker: HOOKER
dialogues.text: You cost me two now!

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: My name's Bryan... But she is not listening to him, because over his shoulde she sees a car approaching.

dialogues.speaker: HOOKER
dialogues.text: (scared) Oh god! You better leave!

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I thought we were negotiating! The hooker steps back as a flashy SUV rolls up. A big, brutish Thug, ANTON THE ALBANIAN, steps out of the passen side, approaches Bryan.

dialogues.speaker: HOOKER
dialogues.text: Anton! I swear it's not my fault! I told him to fuck off...  58. Anton puts a finger on her lips.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Shhh... She quiets immediately.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (to Bryan) Why are you bothering the girl?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: What's it your business?

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: She is my business. He crowds Bryan, towering over him.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: And if you are not spending money, you are costing money.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I was negotiating.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: There is no negotiating. The price is the price. And now you also owe me for two that got away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregor in the car. Watching the little drama, not understanding what is going on.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I don't owe you... Anton grabs Bryan by the front of his jacket, slams him against the wall. Bryan grabs onto the lapels of Anton's jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan's hand. Attaching a small, almost imperceptible, bu on the inside of the lapel.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Fifty euros or I kick your ass.

dialogues.speaker: OK, ..OK...
dialogues.text: Bryan reaches into his pocket, extracts some bills.  59.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Here's fifty. Anton grabs the bills, takes an additional few.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: And another fifty for being an asshole. He shoves Bryan hard.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Now get the fuck out of here. I see you again, I kill you. Bryan stumbles away, hurrying off. Over his shoulder, Ant is making like he is going to slap the Hooker, who cringe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan re enters the car to a shaken Gregor.

dialogues.speaker: GREGOR
dialogues.text: Mr. Smith. I do not know what kind of job I am supposed to do for you but...

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: You were hired to translate. Bryan takes a device out of his bag.

dialogues.speaker: GREGOR
dialogues.text: Yes. But translate what? Bryan switches the device on. Voices start coming out.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
