dialogues.text: That. They both look out the windshield as Anton is speaking to the man driving the SUV. An astonished Gregor hesitates f a moment.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Translate. Gregor begins to translate.

dialogues.speaker: GREGOR
dialogues.text: They are talking about you.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: What about me?

dialogues.speaker: GREGOR
dialogues.text: They are saying not nice things.  60.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Be specific.

dialogues.speaker: GREGOR
dialogues.text: They are saying, excuse me, what an asshole you are. (beat) Please if you can explain why we are doing...

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Just translate.

dialogues.speaker: GREGOR
dialogues.text: One of them says the sausage gave him heartburn... Bryan closes his eyes, no sleep in twenty four hours is starting to catch up with him.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Keep going.

dialogues.speaker: GREGOR
dialogues.text: The other is suggesting something his grandmother used to give him for the same thing. (beat) Do you really want to hear all this?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Every word.

dialogues.speaker: GREGOR
dialogues.text: Now they are talking football. You are American?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: GREGOR
dialogues.text: It is different from what we call football here. We play with the foot.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I know that. Now what are they saying?

dialogues.speaker: GREGOR
dialogues.text: Still about football. They are talking about the game between Lazio and Marseilles. They lost money on the betting. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: GREGOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now they are talking about someone they know who made fifty thousand on one game and then lost it. Perhaps if I knew what the purpose was...

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: You're better off not knowing. Is it still football?

dialogues.speaker: GREGOR
dialogues.text: One is on the phone. He has to go to a job at the Freeway. Something about the fresh merchandise giving problems. Bryan's eyes open, suddenly engaged.

dialogues.speaker: GREGOR
dialogues.text: I don't understand any of this. Bryan sees Anton's SUV pulling out down the street.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: You're not supposed to. Thank you. Bryan leans over, opens Gregor's door.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Good bye. Gregor looks at him askance, is about to exit the car.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I asked for a English Albanian dictionary. Did you bring it? Gregor hands him a book.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Thank you. Gregor exits the car. He is barely out, when Bryan jams h foot on the accelerator and zooms off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregor watches as Bryan speeds away. POV someone else also watching both Bryan and Gregor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A figure, shrouded in shadows, in a car, watching through the windshield.  62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge construction project operating twenty four hours a day, seven days a week. With all the attendant mountains mud and grit and massive earth moving equipment. Tons of earth is moved, tons of cement is produced, miles steel is welded. Day and night, the work never stops, shi of men come on, others go off. But the work never stops. Giant cranes stand like creatures from another planet, mo under the glare of oversized braces of construction light Under which a hundred men labor at the backbreaking work highway construction. Surreal is the only way to describe the scene. Lining the shadowed perimeter of the site are rows and ro of trailers, some offices, most dormitories, long mobile caravans, housing the transitory work force of (mostly) immigrant laborers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anton's SUV. Waits outside a very long trailer where thir workmen wait ina line to enter. A huge Albanian thug stan guard at the door, a card board box next to him. AS a man exits the trailer, buttoning up his work suit, h hands a plastic card with a number on it to the Albanian, who beckons the next man in the line to step forward. The man hands him money, the Albanian hands him the number, a a small towel from the cardboard box. The man steps into the trailer. A moment later Anton comes out, jokes with the Huge Alban takes a wad of money from him and walks off towards his c As he passes the line of workers, one man close to the fr of the line, turns away. As Anton enters his car, he turn back. It is Bryan. In worker's clothes. Two workers come out of the trailer.

dialogues.speaker: ALBANIAN
dialogues.text: Next ! . Bryan and the man in front of him step up and take a numb and a towel, enter the trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan enters the trailer, and what he sees is: a long ais with five cubicles on either side. Long wires with blanke hanging from them afford dubious privacy to each cubicle. Numbers are pinned to each blanket.  63. Bryan looks at his number. Finds the corresponding blanke goes behind it. What he finds is a young girl, laying ona cot with soiled sheets, drugged up, dulled, wearing nothi but an unbuttoned blouse. Half a dozen discarded small to fill a small cardboard box in the corner. Next to the bed Bryan's eyes go to a bucket, with a half dozen used condo in it. The girl looks up at Bryan, holds a condom up ina lazy, indifferent hand, and mechanically spreads her legs. Brya Fights back his revulsion, retreats. Back out in the corridor, Bryan collects himself, uses al his will power to keep from throwing up, remembers why he there, goes to the next blanket, pulls it aside, sees... Another girl laying on a cot, naked, with dull drugged ey and a man just unbuttoning his pants.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Hey ! Bryan lets the blanket drop. He moves on to the next blan pulls it aside to another dazed, naked girl, laying on a soiled cot, and another man, just pulling his pants on, u the towel to wipe himself off. Bryan quickly withdraws. Bryan pulls the next blanket aside: a man fucking yet ano girl, who just lays there, a far away glaze in her eyes, while he pounds away. Out in the corridor again, Bryan moves on. Pulls the next blanket, finds a man about to mount another of the glazed over girls, whose face he cannot see. Is about to withdra again, when he sees, on the floor by the bed, a Jean jack with the word DOLLFACE, sequined on the back.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: Bryan sees Kim rushing off with Amanda down the plane concourse. The lights reflecting off the sequined word DOLLFACE on the back of her jacket. Bryan springs forward, grabs the man by the back of his s pulls him off the girl... What the...??? Before another word can come out of his mouth, Bryan has knocked him out with a sharp blow to the jaw. Bryan turns immediately to the girl expecting to find Kin but instead finds a complete stranger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan lifts the jean jacket to the girl's unfocused eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Where did you get this? The girl looks at him, uncomprehending. Bryan sees a seri of fresh needle tracks on her arms. Her response is to ho up a condom, spread her legs. Bryan takes the soiled shee and covers her.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Where did you get this? Trying to get her to focus.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: (garbled) I am good...

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Who gave it to you? The girl lapses into her drugged state.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Who gave this to you?

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: I am good... Suddenly, the blanket is ripped aside, and the Huge Alban is standing there. Before he can say a word, Bryan has la out with a kick that sends him staggering back. The Albanian falls back, crashes into the blankets on the other side of the corridor, grasps onto the wire holding blankets, pulls down the whole row. The men behind the blankets start to yell. The naked girl begin to stir from their dazed states. Bryan gets the girl up, grabs her discarded clothes. The Albanian rises from the floor, draws a gun from his jacket, is about to fire, when Bryan takes the bed sheet whips it toward his hand. The gun flies from his hand. Men leap from the cubicles, pulling on their clothes, run for the exit. The girls rise and stagger about, lost, sto The Albanian charges Bryan. Bryan side steps and with thr lethal moves puts the man out for good. He then turns bac to the girl, lifts her from the bed |

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: I am good...  65.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Yes you are. Now come on. I'm going to take you someplace safe. Bryan gets the jacket around her. She can barely stand. He starts to head for the door, shepherding the girl thro the crowd of naked, stoned women, wobbling around, throug the men rushing for the exit. When three more Albanians come charging through the door. Seeing the chaos, they ke on Bryan and the girl under his arm. They attack. Bryan puts the girl aside and meets the first attack, dispatching the man with one chop to the throat, he spins into the second, with a palm hand to the nose. The third has drawn his gun, fires, hits a woman in front of Bryan. As her chest explodes, Bryan leaps, takes the man out wit Flying kick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anton and three other Albanian thugs are playing cards, w they hear the gunshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan runs back for the girl, who has now gone unconsciou He lifts her in his arms, heads for the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Workers are running off into the night, half a dozen ston women are wandering about. Bryan hustles the girl out, and into the back seat of an SUV. He lays her down, straps her in with both sets of se belts, is about to hop in the front seat, when he sees a of gasoline by the side of a shed. Bryan tears the sleeve off his construction outfit, stuff it into the top of the can, lights the make shift fuse, t a running start and flings the can with all his might. Th can sails through the air, rag/fuse leaving a flaming tra behind. The can hits the trailer, explodes. The security men, the gathered construction workers, even some of the stoned girls, jump as the entire trailer goes in flames. A REAL ATTENTION GETTER THAT. Bryan is about to get into the SUV, when a shot shatters Side window. He looks up to four very banged up construct Site SUV's's, led by Anton's unblemished one, racing towa him. |  66. Anton hangs out the window, fires his gun at Bryan. Who jumps into the SUV, takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The banged up SUV's push past Anton's , training their headlights on Bryan's vehicle. Anton's SUV veers off, out of sight. Bryan races across the muddied rutted terrain, with the S racing after him like a pack of predatory jackals. One of the SUV's shoots past the others, comes right up on Bryan rear, Bryan looks in his rear view mirror, sees the man in the pulling a gun, Bryan turns the wheel sharply, heads down an impossibly s grade, spewing gravel and mud. The SUV jumps off the grade, follows. Bryan's car veers sideways as he struggles to control the wheel. The SUV gains on him. Bryan sees the grade bottomi out, spins the wheel so the car is straight. As he hits t bottom, he hits the brakes hard. Stops abruptly. The SUV so close, does not anticipate. Smashes right into the rea of Bryan's car. The driver flies right through his windshield, shattering both the window and his face. Bryan guns the SUV, takes off again because the other two SUV's have come around the side of the grade and are clos fast. Bryan looks ahead, sees up above on a plateau, four Massive earth movers pushing tons of dirt and rock down i a depression. Bryan races right towards the landslide about to happen. The SUV's race to catch him. Bryan keeps watching the movement up above. Slows down ju enough for the SUV's to come closer, maneuvers right unde the landslide of earth coming down. The dirt starts to hit his windshield, making visibility precarious. He slows even more. Checks the SUV's in the mirror, sees the men on them pulling their guns, not look up, just intent on their prey. And then, just as the SUV's have Bryan in range, a rumbli distracts them and they see a landslide of earth coming d Bryan guns his SUV, rockets just ahead of the massive sli driving blind in the cascading debris and dirt. The SUV's, caught in the middle of the slide, unprotected glass and steel, are doomed.  67. The first earth hits them, blinds them, and then buries t Bryan drives blind, but manages to come out the other sid of the slide. Only to see, right in front of him, bearing down, Anton i his SUV, leaning out his window, firing his gun. Bryan's windshield takes two hits; Anton's SUV shows no s of slowing. To avoid the head on collision, Bryan veers o to the left. Anton skids hard, follows. Bryan races into a series of cranes lifting large steel b Anton follows him. Spinning his wheel around the giant cranes and their swin loads, Bryan kicks up mud and gravel, splattering Anton's windshield, making it hard for him to see. Bryan sees a load of steel beams being lifted off the gro swinging left to right. He cuts hard around them. Tips them with his front fender. The beams spin around fast. Anton, barely able to see through the debris and mud splattering on his windshield, does not see the beam end that crashes through his windshield, until it is too late It crushes his chest. Bryan looks back, sees the beam jammed through Anton's windshield, looks over at the back seat at the unconsciou girl. Sirens are sounding in the distance. Bryan looks up and sees the flashing lights of police cars approaching. He drives off in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car parked in the shadows. The driver watching, puts hi car in gear, follows Bryan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan roams the aisles, reading labels for ingredients, b various medicines, picks up an IV kit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan exits, heads for the SUV, notices a car parked down the street, a man behind the wheel. Bryan enters his car, drives off. The car follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan looks over at the girl sleeping in the back seat. H eyes fix on the DOLLFACE jacket covering her.  68.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: Bryan is ina store, shopping with Kim. Bryan holds up a jean jacket with the word DOLLFACE in sequins on the back Kim's eyes light up.

dialogues.speaker: END FLASH
dialogues.text: Bryan looks in his rear view mirror, sees the car that ha been following him is two car lengths behind. Bryan looks up ahead, sees a traffic light turning red, s two cars ahead of him. Just as the light turns red, Bryan accelerates, cuts arou the two cars between him and the light, makes a tire screeching u turn, cutting off the traffic coming the oth way, heads up the other side of the avenue, sees the car that has been following, caught, trapped. Sees the driver talking frantically into his cell phone. Bryan gives him the finger, makes his first sharp right turn into a small street, disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a quiet, deserted street, the SUV is parked next toa smaller car. Bryan is at the door of the smaller car, jimmies the lock Returns to the SUV, picks the girl up off the seat, depos her in the smaller car. Bryan hot wires the car, drives off, disappears at the en of the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the desk of a seedy hotel where cash is all you ne for a room, and no ID is required, GILLES, a rumpled, wiz night clerk dozes, stirs to a soft knocking. Looks up to.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Ah! Monsieur Allen...

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Hello Gilles. How is the wife?

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Still in charge. It is a very long time since I have seen you.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Yes. But here I am.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: The usual accommodation?  69.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Plus one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan gerry rigs an intravenous unit up. Crushes the various meds he bought to powder. Concocts a solution. Inserts the IV needle into the girl's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the intravenous drips into the unconscious girl's body Bryan takes Kim's jacket, brushes it off, removes some gr from it, hangs it up, smoothing it out. Lingers over the touch of the material in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: Kim trying on the jacket in the shop, twirling around, modeling it for Bryan. Here excitement brings a smile to his face.

dialogues.speaker: END FLASH
dialogues.text: Fighting down his darkest fears, Bryan is unable to staun the tears that form in the corners of his eyes. He sits down heavily in a ratty side chair, fatigue overwhelming him. He has not slept in three days now. His eyes begin t close, his body begins to unwind...when his cell phone ri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean-Claude, wearing an almost imperceptible ear piece, w impatiently by a statue in a park where a few early morni joggers circle the green, and a group of old Chinese men women do Tai Chi in unison on the grass oval. His cell ph rings. Jean-Claude already knows who it is when he answer

dialogues.speaker: JEAN -CLAUDE
dialogues.text: Bryan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan. Standing on a rooftop talking into a walkie talkie peering through a pair of binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: You can tell them to stop jogging now.

dialogues.speaker: J BAN -CLAUDE
dialogues.text: (caught) They could use the exercise. Looks at the men jogging past him. Exchanging knowing gla with them. They stop jogging. As they appear in the barre of the binoculars...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent/technicians monitor the call with sophisticated tra equipment, try to get a location on the origin of the sig

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: Vectoring. Searching for location. Jean-Claude hears this in an ear piece.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: You didn't really think I was going to come down there, did you?

dialogues.speaker: JBAN- CLAUDE
dialogues.text: I didn't think you were going to make such a mÃ©ss. The monitor in the van locks on a location.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT /TECH
dialogues.text: We have him!

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I didn't have time to worry about neatness.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN
dialogues.text: I know. You have seventy hours.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Had. Now I have fifty six.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN
dialogues.text: No. Now you have none.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars filled with agents race through the streets.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN-CLAUDE
dialogues.text: My chief wanted to arrest you. I convinced him to send you home. Air France OO1. He holds an airline ticket over his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaves today at Two. First class. Courtesy of the French government for past services rendered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The agent's cars converge on one street.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: And what about my daughter?

dialogues.speaker: JEAN-CLAUDE
dialogues.text: I told you, I sit behind a desk now. I take my orders from someone who Sits behind a bigger desk. Four murders, three in hospital, a building burned to the ground. Total chaos at the airport. He wanted your ass in chains. It's the best I could do. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Sorry doesn't cut it.
The agent's cars come to a screeching halt. The agents le out of the cars, run into a building.

dialogues.speaker: JBAN- CLAUDE
dialogues.text: You can't beat the State Bryan! You know that!

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I'm not trying to beat the State. I'm trying to save my kid. (beat) And it was a trailer, not a building. Bryan sees the agents bursting onto a far roof top with h binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN- CLAUDE
dialogues.text: Do you have him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Agents are standing by a walkie talkie positioned nex to a cell phone sitting on a crate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan steps out of an alley, tosses the walkie talkie int garbage can, and walks up a street, right past the empty cars of the agents.  72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl wakes slowly, groggy. She looks up at the intravenous. Looks at a very sleep deprived Bryan who is copying something onto a piece of paper from the dictiona he got from Gregor. He sticks the paper in his pocket. Th girl reaches up for the intravenous needle, weakly.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: It's fluids... Her still clouded eyes focus on Bryan, who has stopped he hand from removing the needle in her arm.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: And medication to counteract the drugs. She seems to relax.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Where did you get this? He holds up Kim's jacket.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: (accented, still drugged) The boy was very nice. Said come to a party.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Where did you get the jacket? Did you get it from this girl? He holds up a picture of Kim. The girl nods.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: IT was cold. She give it to me. The girl starts to cry, quietly.

dialogues.speaker: . GIRL
dialogues.text: I am good. I am good.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Where did she give you the jacket?

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: The house.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: What house?

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: With the red door.  73.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: A red door opens to an innocuous house, like any other ho on the street. The girl, escorted by a pleasant looking man, is flirty, at ease until she enters, is confronted b six Albanian thugs. Suddenly the reality of what is about to happens hits her. Fright fills her face, she goes to run, they grab her.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: He said it was a party...

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: Held down by three men, struggling, she is handcuffed to bed as. a fourth man injects a syringe into her arm. Anot man stands by with what appears to be a gynecological instrument. The men rip off her skirt, spread her legs. The man with the instrument comes closer.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: I am good girl...

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: A man fucks the handcuffed girl as she lays in a semi conscious state.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: Another injection is administered to the semi coherent gi aman in the background begins to unzip his pants.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: First the shot, then the man.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: The same thing occurs in rapid succession. Shot administe men fucking her.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Over and over. She begins to cry.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: I am good girl... Bryan is shaken to his very core. He wipes the girl's tea

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: What about her? Holds up Kim's picture.  74.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: What about this girl?

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: The girl lays on a bed shaking. Kim is pushed into the ro Kim sees her pitiful state, lays her jacket over the girl

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Did they... He can't even bring himself to think about the possibilit

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: What happened to her?

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: Kim, drugged, semi conscious, is held down on the bed, he jeans are ripped off, her legs are spread, the man with t gynecological device approaches.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Do you know where the house is?

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Paradise...

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: The girl is in a car, under the influence of drugs, her e open and close, her vision is blurred.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: A street sign in CLOSE UP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A house with a red door, just like any other house on the street, innocuous, well kept, quiet, set back from the st On the small porch, two Albanian thugs play cards, come t attention when...

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Good morning. Cleaned up, looking very official in a suit, enters the y

dialogues.speaker: ALBANIAN
dialogues.text: I help you?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I'm here to see your boss.  75.

dialogues.speaker: ALBANTAN
dialogues.text: No boss. Bryan hands him the card he took from Jean-Claude. The th looks at it. Is a bit taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: ALBANIAN
dialogues.text: We are doing nothing wrong here. Bryan takes out his cell phone, has his finger poised ove the keypad.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I push one button and thirty agents will be here before you can scratch your worthless balls. Now stop fucking around, before I shut you down for wasting my time.

dialogues.speaker: ALBANIAN
dialogues.text: (rattled) Wait here. He enters the house, leaving Bryan under the watchful eye his cohort. Bryan scans the house, taking note of the details: windows, doors, utilities. The first thug reappears.

dialogues.speaker: ALBANIAN
dialogues.text: You have weapon?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: You're holding it. He alludes to the card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan is led down a narrow hallway toward the kitchen. On the way, he passes a room where four men are playing card He passes a staircase, where a man is descending, buttoni his pants, another is ascending. Bryan looks past the man descending, to the top of the stairs. Then he locks eyes with the man.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: (challenging) What? It is all Bryan can do to reach up and rip his throat out But he doesn't. He moves on.  76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man who led him in stands by the stove. Four other Albanians sit at a table drinking coffee. All have mustac all have tattoos of a crescent and a star on their right hand between the thumb and the forefinger.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Black, one sugar, please. Alludes to the coffee pot. One of the men at the table no to the thug who brought Bryan in. He gets the coffee.

dialogues.speaker: MAN 1
dialogues.text: What is it you want? He speaks with a lisp.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I'm here to negotiate the rates.

dialogues.speaker: MAN 1
dialogues.text: We have already negotiated the rates with Mr. Macon.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Mr. Macon has moved to another division. I am here for the re negotiation. The Men say nothing, look at each other, then back at Bry who takes a sip of the coffee.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Very nice coffee. (beat) Unless you think I am being unreasonable, let me explain our position. We have you under satellite surveillance twenty four hours a day. The Men all look up to the ceiling, out the windows.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: We hear everything you say, we know everything you do. Do you have any idea what it cost just to change the angle of the lens on a satellite orbiting 200 miles above the Earth? And those costs have gone up. Our costs go up, your costs go up. It is only logical. (beat) By the way, which one of you is Marko?  He speaks 77.

dialogues.speaker: MAN 2
dialogues.text: Why do you want to know? with a very high voice.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I was told Marko is in charge.

dialogues.speaker: MAN 1
dialogues.text: We are all Marko.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Marko from Skopje.

dialogues.speaker: MAN 2
dialogues.text: We are all from Skopje.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: If that is the game you want to play, the rate just went up ten percent.

dialogues.speaker: MAN 2
dialogues.text: If you are trying to make extortion on us because we are immigrants, we know the law.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I am extorting you because you are breaking the law. Now which charge would you like to be arrested for? The drugs? The kidnapping? Or the prostitution? The men look from one to the other. Again the

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: You come to our country, take advantage of our system, and think because we are tolerant, we are weak, and helpless. Your arrogance offends me. And for that, the rate just went up another ten percent. men trade a look.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: You want to get down to business? Or you want to keep playing? The atmosphere grows more tense by the moment. Bryan star at the Albanians, the Albanians stare back. The thug behi Bryan has his hand tucked into his coat. Then the tension is broken by...

dialogues.speaker: MAN 1
dialogues.text: How much?  78.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Better. Twenty percent. The Man blinks.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: And you have my word it will not go up (beat ) For a year. Bryan goes to scoop sugar in his coffee from a pot on the table. Addresses the third man.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: How do you say sugar in your language?

dialogues.speaker: MAN 3
dialogues.text: (Albanian) sugar. His voice is very deep. Bryan repeats the word.

dialogues.speaker: MAN 1
dialogues.text: And what does the extra twenty percent buy us?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: It buys you the future. Again the men look at each other. Man 1 pulls out a wad o bills, counts some bills, puts them on the table.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: You've made a very good investment. He takes the money, pockets it, finishes his coffee...

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: See you in a month. Gets up to go. Then, as if forgetting something, he takes piece of paper out of his pocket, the paper he copied wor on from the Albanian dictionary. He turns to the fourth man, who has said nothing.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: A friend gave this to me. It's Albanian. You mind translating it for me? The man stares at the paper, suspicious, looks at the oth The others shrug. He reads from the paper, translates...

dialogues.speaker: MAN 4
dialogues.text: Good luck.  79.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: The mustached mouth saying:

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Good luck. Into Kim's phone. Same voice. Being replayed on Bryan's recorder over and over:

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: You don't remember me. Marko looks at him, uncomprehending.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: We spoke on the phone three days ago. Marko doesn't understand.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I told you I would find you. Now Marko remembers. He reaches into his jacket. In the flash of an eye, before he can get his weapon out, Bryan lashes out, chops his throat. The other men go for their weapons. But Bryan is like lightning. He grabs the two knives from a plate where the were previously cutting sausage and cheese, flings them simultaneously. One knife catches one man in the heart, the other man thr the eye. The third man has his gun out. Bryan breaks his neck befo he can get a shot off. | Bryan takes the gun. Deliberately fires a shot into the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the front room, the men playing cards hear the shot.  80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two men come running out of rooms, pulling up their pants pulling out their guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men from the front room come rushing in to find bodie blood everywhere. But before they can understand that the is one more body than there were men in the room, one of bodies rises. Bryan shoots so fast, the men are dead before they know i Bryan heads out of the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men from upstairs come running down the stairs, r to the kitchen. Find the bodies. Hear a noise of feet running up stairs behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men come running back the way they came, the foot still sounding on the stairs. As they turn the corner to head up the stairs, they come face to face with Bryan, stamping his feet on the stairs the cadence of someone walking. Their momentary surprise ail he needs to shoot them dead. Bryan turns and heads up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cautiously, Bryan comes to a line of closed doors. His ne keening, he moves forward to the first door. He opens it slowly. Finds a half naked woman, out of it on drugs, handcuffed to a bed. He opens another door. Finds another girl in the same condition. His stomach knotting, he opens a third door. In the dim light, Bryan cannot make out the face. The woman bears a Similarity to Kim, Bryan hurries over to her, turns her head into the light. It is not Kim. Bryan rushes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan knocks down door after door, finding naked, drugged bound women in various states of ravaged. None of them is Kim.  B81. Bryan kicks down one last door, and finds...

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Amanda ! Amanda, hands tied to a post behind the bed, her eyes ope staring into eternity. Foam drips out of the corner of he slack mouth. A syringe is still inserted in her arm. She is dead. A BLUR comes into focus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kim's picture.

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK TO
dialogues.text: Marko's face. Staring at Kim's picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Light seeps in through the floor boards, creating a mix o light and shadow. Marko is trussed, spread eagled, naked on a rack that loo like some sort of S&M sex device. Two wires run from his groin to a light switch on the wall. Bryan's hand is on t switch.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: MARKO
dialogues.text: Fuck you. Bryan sticks a cloth in Marko's mouth, his hand hits the switch. A bare bulb goes on, flickers with the flow of current. Marko shrieks into the cloth, in absolute agony, as curre flows through his gonads. Bryan turns the switch off. The room goes back into shado and strips of light.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: (calm) You know we used to out source this sort of thing. But what we found was the countries we out sourced to had unreliable power grids. Very third world. Sometimes you'd turn the switch on, there'd be no power for hours. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And then tempers would get short, people would resort to things like pulling finger nails, acid drips on bare skin. The whole exercise would become...counter productive. But here the power is stable, there's a nice even flow. Here you can flip a switch and the power stays on all day. He takes the cloth out of Marko's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: MARKO
dialogues.text: I don't know. Bryan stuffs the rag back in Marko's mouth, hits the swit leaves it on. Marko screams in unimaginable agony. Bryan flips the switch off. Marko has snot running from h nose, saliva from his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Now I don't have any more time to waste Marko from Skopje. You either give me what I need, or this switch will stay on until they turn the power off for lack of payment on the bill. Where is my daughter?

dialogues.speaker: MARKO
dialogues.text: (weakly) We do not keep virgin. We sell them.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: You sold my daughter? Marko nods.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: To who?

dialogues.speaker: MARKO
dialogues.text: I don't know. Bryan goes to stuff the rag back in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: MARKO
dialogues.text: St. Clair!

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: St. Clair. Is that a person? A place?  83.

dialogues.speaker: MARKO
dialogues.text: St. Clair. St. Clair. Person. Patrice St. Clair!

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Where do I find this person Patrice St. Clair?

dialogues.speaker: MARKO
dialogues.text: Don't know. Bryan's hand goes to the switch.

dialogues.speaker: MARKO
dialogues.text: Don't know! Don't know! Please! Don't know!

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I believe you. He gives Marko a pat on the back.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: But it's not going to save you. He does not bother to put the rag in Marko's mouth, just hits the switch. The light bulb keeps flickering. Bryan walks out of the room to the most horrendous scream ever to come from a human throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean-Claude walks down the street, a baguette under his a Comes to his house, lets himself in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean-Claude enters his house.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN -CLAUDE
dialogues.text: I'm home. Removes his coat, hangs it in the closet, proceeds down t haliway.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN-CLAUDE
dialogues.text: I could smell the chicken all the way down the street... Enters a room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where he finds his two young children, in their Pajamas, his wife, sitting at the dinner table, a chicken and asso side dishes laid out.  84.

dialogues.speaker: ISABELLE
dialogues.text: hook who dropped by... Jean-Claude takes a moment, recovers.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN
dialogues.text: Bryan. What a pleasant surprise.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Yes. I thought you would like it.

dialogues.speaker: TSABELLE
dialogues.text: The children waited up for you. If you'll tuck them in we can eat before everything gets cold. Bryan, will you do the honors? Hands him a cork screw and a bottle of wine.

dialogues.speaker: J BAN
dialogues.text: T'll] just be a minute. Come on kids. Jean-Claude exits with the kids.

dialogues.speaker: TRACK WITH
dialogues.text: Jean-Claude walks the kids down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN -CLAUDE
dialogues.text: Go inside. Get in bed. I'll be right there. He nudges them to their bedroom, then slips into a small bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean-Claude reaches under a sink and comes up with a gun, which he hides in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean~Claude enters.

dialogues.speaker: TSABELLE
dialogues.text: I was just telling Bryan how nice it has been since you left the old job for the new one. Home every night for dinner, get to see the kids more.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Yes. Must be nice coming home and seeing your kids every night, knowing they're safe. Jean-Claude is growing increasingly uncomfortable.  85.

dialogues.speaker: ISABELLE
dialogues.text: Bryan has been thinking of relocating.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: ISABELLE
dialogues.text: Yes. To Paris. He's been looking at houses. (to Bryan) White or dark meat?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Dark please. As she serves him...

dialogues.speaker: JRAN- CLAUDE
dialogues.text: Find anything interesting? BRYAN . As a matter of fact I did. Over in the eighteenth. On Rue Paradis. The people there know someone who works in your office, I think. A Monsieur Macon? Jean-Claude tenses. Bryan sees the reaction.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: You know him?

dialogues.speaker: LSABELUOE
dialogues.text: Oh Henri. I call him Mr. Nervous. Always looks like he has is about to have a problem. Carrots? She holds up the serving plate.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Thank you. : Takes a spoonful on his plate.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I got to the bottom of it Jean. I know everything. I hope you're not involved in this shit.

dialogues.speaker: ISABELLE
dialogues.text: What. shit?

dialogues.speaker: JEAN
dialogues.text: This is not the time or place Bryan.

dialogues.speaker: ISABELLE
dialogues.text: What are you two talking about?  86.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Are you involved?

dialogues.speaker: ISABELLE
dialogues.text: Involved in what? Will somebody tell me...

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Because if you are... Jean-Claude pulls his gun, points it at Bryan.

dialogues.speaker: TSABELLE
dialogues.text: Jean!

dialogues.speaker: JEAN
dialogues.text: My salary is X. My expenses are Y. I do not know where the difference between the two comes from. As long as my family is provided for, I do not care where the difference comes from. That is my entire involvement.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: And what about my family Jean?

dialogues.speaker: JEAN
dialogues.text: I told you I would help you as long as it did not cause trouble for me.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Who is Patrice St. Clair?

dialogues.speaker: JEAN-CLAUDE
dialogues.text: I don't know. I don't care. I'm driving you to the airport.

dialogues.speaker: ITSABELLE
dialogues.text: Jean! Please tell me...

dialogues.speaker: JEAN
dialogues.text: Shut up Isabelle! Just shut up! To Bryan.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN
dialogues.text: Let's get going. Dinner is over.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I'm not finished. Jean-Claude menaces with the gun.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN- CLAUDE
dialogues.text: Yes you are.  87. Bryan opens his hand, drops the bullets from the gun on t table.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: No I'm not. Jean-Claude pulls the trigger. Click click.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: That's what happens when you sit behind a desk. You stop paying attention to the details. You forget things. Like the weight in the hand of a gun that is loaded and one that is not. In the flash of an eye, Bryan takes out his own gun. Shoo Isabelle in the shoulder. She falls to the floor screamin Jean-Claude goes to move. Bryan takes him to the table wi an immobilizing arm lock, presses the gun to his head.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN
dialogues.text: You bastard!

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: It's a flesh wound. But if you don't get me what I need, the last thing you'll see before I make your children orphans is the bullet I put between her eyes. (beat) Patrice St. Clair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The name Patrice St. Clair is typed into a computer scree A dossier marked with the Securite code comes up for PATR ST. CLAIR. The first page comes up, a photo, obviously ta clandestinely, of a very urbane looking man, in his early fifties, exuding an air of culture and a pampered life.

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK
dialogues.text: To Jean-Claude at his home computer with Bryan over his shoulder. As the dossier rolls out on the screen...

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: You could have made this much less painful for everyone involved if you had been more concerned about my daughter, and less concerned about your fucking desk. (beat) Please apologize to your wife for me. He shoots Jean-Claude in the thigh.  88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through a pair of binoculars, Patrice St. Clair in a tuxe warmly greets ALT, a very cultured, obviously refined, Mi Eastern man in his late thirties, also in formal attire, is accompanied by a not very refined BODYGUARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: St. Clair leads Ali and his retinue through the front doo of a mansion, where other elegantly dressed guests can be seen gathering through the double story salon windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan. Lowering the binoculars from his vantage point on one of the bridges across the Seine. In the distance, on the far shore of the river, is the St. Clair mansion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean-Claude's official ID. With Jean-Claude's name and position, but Bryan's picture.

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK
dialogues.text: To the Security scrutinizing Bryan against his ID. Satisf they hand him back the credentials, step aside. Bryan ent

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A formal party is in progress. Bryan is the only one not dressed for the affair. Waiters circulate with hors d'oeu and flutes of champagne. Bryan moves through the crowd, trying to get his bearings when he sees St. Clair, across the room, accompanied by t discreet security men, being admitted through a secured d into a small elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan approaches the Security man at the door.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm here to see Mr. St Clair.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY
dialogues.text: Your name? Bryan flashes Jean-Claude's ID. The Security man consults guest list.  89.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Your name is not on the list.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Please look again. As the man looks down, Bryan buries a lightning fast knuc punch to his temple, catching him before he falls. Proppi the man up, Bryan opens the elevator door, disappears ins

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan exits the elevator to a garage and several luxury c He leaves the unconscious Security Man, heads through a d at the far end of the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan emerges to a circular hallway, wrapping around a wa with intermittent doors. From behind the wall he hears lo voices, and then applause. Bryan hears footsteps coming, turns to a waiter with a champagne bucket and a bottle of champagne, and a single Flute. The waiter stops, looks at Bryan.

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: May I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali's bodyguard stands before a door. He turns to see Bry approaching with the bucket of champagne.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Your champagne.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY
dialogues.text: I will take it. As he goes to take the tray, Bryan jams the tray forward into his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali, the sophisticated Middle Easterner Bryan saw at the entrance to the mansion, sits ina comfortable club chair, in a tastefully appointed room, facing a floor to ceiling window that looks out on a stage where a naked girl of ab nineteen dances, gyrating listlessly, while a man behind watches.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: I have fifty thousand. A moment...  90.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: One hundred. Ali hits the button again.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: One Â£ifty. Bryan watches, astounded,

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Your champagne sir. Krug Reserve 1985. He displays the bottle. Ali does not turn from the window Hits a button on the desk next to him.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: I have two.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: May I serve?

dialogues.speaker: ALT
dialogues.text: Please. Bryan opens the bottle. Begins to pour.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: I have two... From his vantage point, Bryan can see several other rooms just like the one he is in facing the stage. A voice come over a loudspeaker.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Sold for Two hundred thousand. Applause comes from behind the walls. The window goes bla Ali makes a note ina book. Dials on his cell, speaks in Arabic.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: The last item. The light comes on. Ali's attention turns to the window where the next girl is brought in. He drains his glass, holds it out for another pour, not taking his eyes off th window. Bryan pours, but also keeps his eyes on the windo As before, the girl is wearing a silk robe, her back is t the window.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: As usual we save the best for last. Speaks English. Some French. Certified Pure.  91. Bryan hears this, and an ominous chill runs up his spine. He hopes against hope.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: Hey! Bryan looks down, sees he has poured over the rim of the glass, soaked Ali's sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: Get out. He pays Ali no mind. Because his worst nightmare has come true. The robe is removed, the girl is turned. Standing there, with dulled drugged eyes, naked, for sale to the highest bidder, is Kim. The music comes on, Kim, prodded by the man behind her, s to dance listlessly.

dialogues.speaker: ALT
dialogues.text: I said... Bryan pulls a gun. Puts it right to Ali's forehead.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I heard what you said. Buy her. Ali hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: T have one hundred. A moment.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: One fifty. Ali locks eyes with Bryan, still does not bid.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Two hundred...two fifty... Bryan chambers a round. Ali hits the button.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Three,..three fifty...four... The bidding is fast and furious.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Four fifty... There i8 a pause.  92.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Four fifty...four fifty... Ali does not move. Bryan hits the button.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Five hundred thousand...five hundred...five hundred... No response.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Sold. As the applause comes, the window goes black.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: That concludes the sale for tonight. Thank you all for coming. You can collect your purchases directly.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: ALL
dialogues.text: You will never get away with this.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: If you want to live, you'll make sure I do. Move. He pushes Ali toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens. Ali exits, Bryan right behind him. Becaus the walls are curved, Bryan has no field of vision. No so has Bryan stepped out, then two blackjacks from both side of the curved wall come crashing down on his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan's vision clears. He finds himself in a tool shop, handcuffed to an overhead pipe, facing four Security men and...

dialogues.speaker: ST. CLAIR
dialogues.text: Now Mr... He looks at Bryan's fake ID...

dialogues.speaker: ST. CLAIR
dialogues.text: Well, we know you are not Mr. Jean- Claude. He holds up the ID, peels Bryan's picture off.  93. sT. CLAIR So what do we call you? Bryan says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: ST. CLAIR
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter what we call you really. What does matter is what you are doing here. Would you care to tell me what you are doing here?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: The last girl. I'm her father. This causes some disquiet among the men.

dialogues.speaker: ST. CLAIR
dialogues.text: Oh my.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Give her to me.

dialogues.speaker: ST. CLAIR
dialogues.text: IT wish I could, honestly. I'ma father also. Two sons and a daughter. But let me explain something to you Mr...whoever you are. This is a business. A very unique business with a very unique clientele.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: T'll pay.

dialogues.speaker: ST. CLAIR
dialogues.text: In this business there are no refunds, no returns, no discounts, no buy backs. All sales are final. Besides discretion, it is the only rule we have. As a father, my heart goes out to you. It really does. Asa businessman, I must accept the reality. I'm sorry. St. Clair turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY
dialogues.text: What should we do with him? At the door...

dialogues.speaker: ST. CLAIR
dialogues.text: Kill him. (beat) Quietly. I have guests. St. Clair exits with one of the Security men. The other three men look at each other. }  94. Then at Bryan, who glares at them.

dialogues.speaker: MAN 1
dialogues.text: Gag him. Man 3 takes out a cloth, the other two take out knives. M 3 advances on Bryan. As he gets within range, Bryan pulls down with all his might on the pipe he is handcuffed to, snaps it. The open pipe spews a blast of steam right into Man 3's face. He staggers back, blinded, scalded. Steam begins to fill the room. Man 2 rushes Bryan, leadin with his knife. Bryan wraps the handcuffs around his fore spins halfway, breaks his arm. When, from behind, Man 1 pulls a garrote tight around Bry throat. Bryan reverses fast, gets his handcuffs around th man's neck, pulls hard, snaps his neck like a twig. Man 3 has recovered and charges Bryan with his knife draw Bryan reverses him with a swift deflection and drives him forward, right into the dangling steam pipe. The pipe pie his back and protrudes through his chest; blood sprays in every direction. As he dies, steam shoots out of the pipe Bryan reaches over, removes a gun from the holster of one the dead men, shoots the handcuffs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: St. Clair is waiting for the lift, when he hears the shot

dialogues.speaker: ST. CLATR
dialogues.text: Would you please go and see which part of the word quietly they did not understand?

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY
dialogues.text: Yes sir. The Security Man heads back toward the rear door, when th door swings open and a burst of steam envelops him. Out o the steam a gun fires, blowing a hole in his face. St. Clair stares, stunned, as Bryan emerges from the stea armed. Fire in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ST. CLAIR
dialogues.text: (panicked) We can resolve this. Bryan says nothing, keeps advancing. St. Clair backs up against the lift door.

dialogues.speaker: ST. CLAIR
dialogues.text: I know how you feel. We should talk. We'll work it out.  95. The lift door opens, St. Clair stumbles in , tries to pus the button. Bryan fires one shot, wounding him in his shoulder. St. Clair slumps against the wall, Bryan stands over him.

dialogues.speaker: ST. CLAIR
dialogues.text: You have no idea... Bryan puts a bullet in his other shoulder. St. Clair scre Bryan aims the gun at his leg.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: ST. CLAIR
dialogues.text: Please you must try to understand... Bryan puts a bullet in his leg.

dialogues.speaker: ST. CLAIR
dialogues.text: There's a boat by the quay! Please understand. It was all business. It wasn't personal.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: To you it was all business. To me it was all personal. He pumps the entire clip of bullets into St. Clair. Press the lift button. The doors close. The lift rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guests are mingling, chatting, being so pleasantly so when the lift arrives, opens, and St. Clair's lifeless, b body topples out. A real party ender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guests are rushing out of the mansion, hampering the Secu men trying to rush in. Suddenly...

dialogues.speaker: CRASH
dialogues.text: One of the luxury cars from the garage comes smashing thr the garage doors to the side of the main building, Bryan behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan veers off, avoiding hitting the people scurrying ar The Security draw guns, try to get a bead on him, but Bry jerks the car to the left, without taking his foot off th accelerator, sending the car crashing through a high hedg  96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan races the car through the formal gardens of the man destroying a large fountain, tearing up the plantings, obliterating several benches and a glass gazebo, smashing through the wall surrounding the whole estate, before he careens onto the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan emerges onto the top of the Avenue, sees in the distance, on the river below, a grand boat, built in the Twenties, made all of wood and gleaming chrome, lit up, w several cars approaching. Bryan hits the accelerator, takes a road to the lower qua

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali and his bodyguards bring Kim and two other drugged ou girls onto the boat. More bodyguards greet them on deck.

dialogues.speaker: EAT. SMALL QUAI
dialogues.text: Bryan races along the river on the lower roadway, sees th the boat has left the quai and moved out into the river. Bryan screeches to a stop as the road dead ends, throws t Car into reverse, goes barreling up the road the way he c

dialogues.speaker: KAT. ROADWAY
dialogues.text: On the top of the roadway, traffic runs in the opposite direction. Out of nowhere, Bryan's car blows out of the lower roadway and onto the high quai road. AGAINST THE FL

dialogues.speaker: OF TRAFFIC,
dialogues.text: Cars screech, bang into each other. Bryan sees from his vantage point that the boat has pulled away from the quai and is starting to head out into the river. Bryan jams the gear shift into low, and takes off after t boat. AGAINST THE FLOW OF TRAFFIC. TRACK WITH Bryan as he races against the traffic, keeping one eye on the boat cruising in the middle of the river, the other eye on the cars trying to get out of his way as barrels full speed right at them. Cars careen left and right, slamming into each other, run up on the shoulders of the road, taking out lampposts, gu rails. Bryan pulls even with the boat, still racing headlong int the traffic. Oblivious to the mayhem he is causing, he lo over toward the boat, see several crewmen on deck, but no Sign of Ali or Kim.  97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali enters a stateroom where an older man in Traditional robes, SHEIKH RAHMAN, is reclining on a huge bed.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: (Arabic) They are being prepared sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan races down the road until he comes to a bridge ahea of the boat. He brakes hard, gets out, and starts running to the center of the bridge. He perches right at the rail, waiting for the boat to com closer. On the quai road, the sound of police sirens and the sigh of flashing lights heading right towards him draws Bryan' attention for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali, walking along a corridor hears the noise outside, pe out a window, sees the police cars rushing up the quai, t nothing of it, heads for a door at the end of the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan watches the boat passing underneath the bridge some thirty fee below. He takes a breath, jumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali watches as two Arabic women are dressing Kim and the other spaced out girls in very chic, but very revealing g

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: Show time! And then he hears a loud thump on the deck above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan has hit the deck hard, injuring his ankle. Taking a moment to collect himself, he looks up to see three crewm running towards him, two have clubs, the third a shovel. Bryan manages to find his feet just as they attack. The first man swings his club. Bryan disarms him, crippli him with a blow to the throat. He raises the club just as the shovel comes crashing down, blocking the sharp edge o it and driving the club into the man's jaw in one swift m  98. The third man catches him with the club across the back. Bryan buckles a bit from the blow. The man is about to la another, when Bryan kicks out from the floor, shattering man's knee. The man goes down, screaming in pain. Bryan puts him out his misery with a reverse elbow strike to the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali moves through the corridor, the three dazed girls bei hustled along by two other men, when he sees, through the narrow window above him, a man hitting the deck, blood spurting from his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: You! He motions to one man.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: Come with me! Motions to the other.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: You deliver the girls! Ali and one of the men run off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan makes his way along the deck, favoring his injured ankle, when suddenly a door opens behind him and two men rush out, one with an ax, the other with a machete. Bryan grabs the only weapon available: the oar from a lif boat. Bryan battles both men, skillfully using the oar to defle the blows from the ax and the machete, spinning, feinting blocking, striking, until the man with the machete snaps Oar in two with one downward cut. Just then the man with the ax swings at Bryan. Bryan bloc the blow with one end of the oar, jams the jagged other e into his chest. In one swift circular move, Bryan grabs t ax, Spins, and buries the blade into the chest of the mac wielder. Bryan hears a noise behind him, turns just as two more me emerge, firing guns. Bryan pulls the man he just axed in Front of him. The bullets riddle his body. Bryan spins with the corpse, grabbing the machete, swingi down at the shooter's hands. Chops one man's hand clean off. Severs the second shooter's throat.  99. Another man emerges from the cabin, spraying with an automatic. Bryan pushes the corpse into him, clambers up and over the cabin roof.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE DECK
dialogues.text: Bryan drops back down onto the deck, his ankle crumbling underneath him. He rises, painfully, only to find another three crew, armed with clubs, and knives, charging. The first man attacks with a knife. Bryan lets the knife pass inches from his side, then spins the man and drives knife into the second man who is charging right behind hi The third man swings down with his club, catches Bryan on the shoulder, sends him staggering almost over the side o the boat. The Clubber swings again, Bryan rolls over the rail, latc onto a rope attached to the side, uses the rope to block next blow. He wraps the rope around the man's wrist and pulls. The man flies over the rail, into the river. Bryan clambers back onto the deck, barely has time to cat his breath, when a bullet smashes into the wall next to h head. He turns to the two gunmen, and Ali, coming over th top of the roof. With nowhere to run, he dives through th window leading inside the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan lands in the interior corridor, just as two more me come around the corner, with automatic weapons. They fire. Bryan yanks open a door, which takes the barra of bullets. When the smoke clears, there is no movement from behind t door. The men rush the door, swing it open. There is no one there. | The men run forward, turn the corner, right into two grap hooks, that embed in their chests. Each hook held in one Bryan's hands. Bryan sees a door at the far end of the corridor, grabs o of the automatic weapons from the men he just dispatched, heads towards the door as fast as his bum ankle will carr him. Suddenly from outside on the deck, gunfire shatters the windows, rakes the corridor, tearing the wooden walls. Bryan runs, returns the fire through the windows as he go One man outside falls, another falls. Then Bryan takes a bullet in the arm, loses his weapon as he hits the floor.  100. Bryan struggles up, his arm bleeding, pulls himself up on the shredded wood of the wall, when Ali drops down the st pistol in hand.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: You! He raises his pistol to fire. Bryan's hand, clutching the wooden wall, yanks a board free, and just as Ali fires, h dives forward, somersaults, and comes up right in front o Ali, buries the board in his hand in Ali's forehead. The exposed nails pierce Ali's brain. Ali's eyes stare into Bryan's, go lifeless. Bryan pushes him aside, ignores his own wound, picks up Ali's pistol a limps for the door at the end of the hall. Just as he approaches the door, a shot rings out from ins pierces the door. Bryan falls. The door opens, and Sheikh Rahman appears, pistol in hand Behind him, Kim and the other girls are huddled on the be Rahman stands over Bryan, regards him for a moment, then turns back to the room. He hears a noise. Turns again to Bryan, standing, bloodied.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Party's over. Rahman raises his pistol. Not as fast as Bryan. Bryan dri one shot right through Rahman's forehead. Rahman falls to the floor, dead. Bryan steps into the room, sees Kim on the bed. She looks at him with glazed, drugged eyes. He goes to her.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Kim. She looks up at him, uncomprehending at first, then...

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Daddy... Her eyes light with recognition.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: You came for me. She starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: You came for me. She wraps her arms around him, sobs.  101.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: I told you I would. He holds her close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors to Customs open. Kim emerges, runs into the arms of Lenore. Stuart stands close. Bryan emerges from Customs a moment later, arm in sling, leaning on a cane, favoring his ankle, face bruise and cut, slow to heal.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Bryan... He holds out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: If there's anything you need.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: IT have what I need. Referring to Kim.

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: Bryan. She hugs him, awkward, but heartfelt.

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: Thank you. The awkwardness persists. They separate.

dialogues.speaker: LENORE
dialogues.text: Come on darling. We're going to go home. lLuisa's preparing that chocolate souffle just the way you like it. We'll rent some films, cuddle up. Marc will come over tomorrow for your hair...

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Mom... Lenore stops.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: If it's OK with you, I think I'm going to spend the night at Dad's. Lenore is stunned. But not as stunned as...  102.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Honey. It's OK. You don't have to.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: I know I don't have to. (beat) I want to. A small smile breaks across Bryan's lips, nothing in comparison to the one that fills his heart. Kim puts her arm through his. They walk off, arm in arm. As Lenore and Stuart watch them exit into the bright California day. 3-28-06
